Description: Black-glazed pottery lekythos with splayed foot, slim, barrel-shaped body, concave neck and a flaring flat-topped rim. Wholly glazed outside save lowest wall and foot; the glaze fired red-brown in places; there are traces of a whitish deposit.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GO.386)
